div.div: Upon graduation, Fall Mountain students will have the academic and social abilities to actively apply their knowledge and skills as ethically responsible citizens, well-equipped to succeed in their community, country and world.

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

nav.div: Fall Mountain Regional School District, SAU 60 » District » COVID-19 Info

p.span:
To: Fall Mountain Families & Staff
From: Lori Landry, Superintendent
Date: April 16, 2020
RE: FMRSD Update

Governor Sununu announced that he is extending remote learning through the end of the school year. While it is disappointing that we can not physically be together before the year ends, we will still remain connected and supportive of one another.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: has never been more evident than during this period of time.

Our administrative team has been anticipating the possibility of this and met today to begin planning what the remainder of the year could look like. We will be meeting next week to continue these discussions and will communicate these plans in our next letter.

Governor Sununu and Commissioner Edelblut recognize the great work our teachers are doing in moving to remote instruction and making it work for families and students. We understand the hardship this creates for our students, especially our seniors with the excitement of graduation and end of the year activities. We will continue to be looking for innovative ways to recognize and celebrate our students’ accomplishments.
These are tough times. We will get through this by continuing to work together, supporting one another and by reaching out when help is needed.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-style: italic; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: “Tough times never last, but tough people do.” ~Dr Robert H. Schuller

MEAL SERVICE INFORMATION
Meals will be available for any child under the age of 18 at VMS, CMS, NCCS, and NWS daily. Meal times at all locations will be: 8:00 am -
We will offer meal pickup in Acworth from a school vehicle at 9:00 am at the Village Store and 9:30 am at Town Hall.
